qas.question: about how long ago did the climate become favorable?
what animals did the grasslands provide a new home for?
what diet did the mammals switch to from browsing diets?
the spread of grasslands and what have been strongly linked?
How many years ago did the Cenozoic era start?
In what era did ungulates start eating a browsing diet?
In what era did mammals develop teeth?
In what era did forest biomes start to grow?
When did the Cenozoic era end?

context: During the <b5_0><b6_0><b7_0>Cenozoic<b7_0/><b6_0/><b5_0/> era, specifically <a0_0>about <b4_0><b8_0>25 million<b4_0/> years ago<b8_0/><a0_0/> during the Miocene and Pliocene epochs, the continental climate became favorable to the evolution of grasslands. Existing forest biomes declined and grasslands became much more widespread. The grasslands provided a new niche for <a1_0>mammals<a1_0/>, including many ungulates and glires, that switched from browsing diets to <a2_0>grazing diets<a2_0/>. Traditionally, the spread of grasslands and the <a3_0>development of grazers<a3_0/> have been strongly linked. However, an examination of mammalian teeth suggests that it is the open, gritty habitat and not the grass itself which is linked to diet changes in mammals, giving rise to the "grit, not grass" hypothesis.
